info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 24 at 2:53AM EDT until August 24 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT FOR EASTERN MONROE...WESTERN WAYNE AND SOUTHEASTERN WASHTENAW COUNTIES... At 253 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Flat Rock, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Grosse Ile around 300 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Newport, Whittaker, Gibraltar, Erie, New Boston, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Bolles Harbor, Rockwood and Westland. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
